image.altText: Angus Taylor appears on a video link in front of a Parliament House graphic.

props.synopsis: Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor has confirmed the Coalition will vote to repeal the government's tax changes if it wins office, instead putting forward a 25-cent fuel excise cut as an alternative way to lower the cost of living.

title.children: Labor seizes on Coalition's pledge to repeal 'election bribe' tax cuts

image.altText: Donald Trump shows a signed document in the Oval Office at the White House

props.synopsis: The White House expects the tariffs will raise $US100 billion in revenue annually and foster more domestic manufacturing.

title.children: Donald Trump announces new 25 per cent tariffs on imported vehicles

image.altText: Peter Dutton smiles with trees behind him

props.synopsis: Politics is about principles and the opposition leader's decision to say no to a tax cut sends a signal.

title.children: Peter Dutton's decision to say no to a tax cut sends a signal

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin smiles

props.synopsis: The Russian President reportedly wants Ukraine to cede territory his troops have never occupied as part of negotiations taking place to end the war, which continues to rage despite multiple summits.

title.children: Putin's 'crazy' ceasefire demands akin to British 'reoccupying' NSW

image.altText: A couple at the pub

props.synopsis: Despite Australians paying almost $7 billion for group insurance within super annually, new research shows more than a quarter aren't aware if they have cover or the details of their policies.

title.children: One in four Australians in the dark about their super insurance

image.altText: CCTV footage of a store alight

props.synopsis: Successive governments have increased the tax on cigarettes and tobacco to drive down smoking rates — but having helped with one problem, it has contributed to another.

title.children: Smokers have been pushed onto the black market. There's no easy way back

image.altText: Dutton walks next to a car

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton will promise to halve the tax on fuel for 12 months in his budget reply on Thursday, which the Coalition says would save a two-car household roughly $28 a week on average and reduce inflationary pressures.

title.children: Coalition promises to halve fuel excise, shaving 25c off a litre of petrol

image.altText: A blurred photo of the share trading boards at the Australian stock exchange

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is down in early trade after Wall Street and European stocks were hit by the looming threat of tariffs on US car imports. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX and global stocks fall as more US tariffs shake sentiment

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: US firm CoStar improves bid for Domain
ASX opens in the red after tariffs shake global markets
Woolworths prices higher than a year ago: Choice

image.altText: two men walk through a doorway

props.synopsis: French President Emmanuel Macron says European forces could be used to dissuade future Russian attacks once a peace deal is in place in Ukraine.

title.children: Macron says European forces 'a card in the hand of the Ukrainians'

image.altText: A woman types on a laptop computer.

props.synopsis: Nicole hadn't been in her sales job for even a year when she resigned, but her former employer is now trying to stop her working in the same industry for the next six months.

title.children: 'A huge hit to my career': junior worker faces six month non-compete

image.altText: An illustration of a cityscape with two transparent buildings where the athletes village will go.

props.synopsis: Queensland will need tens of thousands of extra construction workers to satisfy the pipeline of infrastructure for the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games, expected to heap "enormous pressure" on the sector, building experts say.

title.children: Thousands of construction workers needed for Olympics build

image.altText: Generic child toys

props.synopsis: New analysis reveals just how lucrative Australia's childcare real estate market is while parents face perpetual fee hikes.

title.children: As investors rush to buy up childcare centres, fees are rising sharply

image.altText: A man with a septum piercing and white beard and long hair wearing a beanie outside while it snows

props.synopsis: The US conspiracy theorist charged in connection with a deadly attack on Queensland police has told authorities he would have tried to talk the killers out of it if he had the chance.

title.children: Man charged in connection with Wieambilla attack wished he was with shooters

image.altText: Jim Chalmers laughing.

props.synopsis: The $5-a-week tax cuts revealed in the federal budget have passed the Senate in a late-night sitting.

title.children: Surprise tax cuts pass Senate but Coalition vows to repeal them

image.altText: Melbourne International Comedy Festival

props.synopsis: An audience member suffered a medical emergency during the Allstars Supershow at the Palais Theatre in St Kilda.

title.children: Melbourne comedy festival opening stopped due to death in audience

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Pete Hegseth stands behind Donald Trump in the Oval Office.

props.synopsis: It piles pressure on Donald Trump's administration, which has insisted no US service personnel were put at risk due to the leak of sensitive information.

title.children: New Signal messages show Pentagon chief shared live intelligence

image.altText: An unidentified mother and two young children on a round swing in a playground.

props.synopsis: A new report into the massive over-representation of Indigenous children in out-of-home care in Western Australia reveals how factors like homelessness and DV can lead to mothers having their babies taken away.

title.children: Molly was hospitalised after a DV assault — so her baby was taken away

image.altText: A dozen fall army worm specimens on a laboratory agar plate showing signs of a white fungus which killed them.

props.synopsis: The insect said to threaten the food security of 600 million people globally may have met its match in the form of several native Australian fungi and bacteria.

title.children: Fall armyworm was unstoppable. Then it came to Australia

image.altText: A generic graphic of the NDIS logo surrounded by budget-related paraphenalia.

props.synopsis: The NDIS is getting a lot of negative press at the moment. It’s a far cry from when the scheme first started, writes Evan Young.

title.children: There's another problem facing the NDIS. It's probably not what you think

image.altText: Police vehicles at an intersection.

props.synopsis: A female driver is being interviewed by police after a boy was struck by a car and died while walking to school at Teesdale.

title.children: Boy dies after being hit by car at Teesdale, west of Geelong

image.altText: A red dot is a very ancient galaxy surrounded by much brighter, spiral galaxies.

props.synopsis: A tiny red speck has set a date on an important era in the Universe's early history and given astronomers a surprising insight into the "cosmic dawn".

title.children: Light from an ancient galaxy prompts rethink of Universe's history

image.altText: People waiting in line to view a rental property

props.synopsis: More Australian renters believe they may have to rent forever, either by choice or because they are priced out of the market. So what does this mean for "forever renters" in the long term?

title.children: More Australians believe they'll be 'forever renters'. What does it mean?

props.synopsis: Rainfall records at some outback properties have been smashed with major flooding set to continue across parts of western Queensland. The rain band is expected to head east in time for the weekend.

title.children: Outback Qld residents, livestock stranded as 'daunting' rain continues

image.altText: Stephen Chappell

props.synopsis: In his first interview since assuming the job last year, Air Marshall Stephen Chappell has warned the country is in a period of strategic volatility as potential military threats grow across the Indo-Pacific, and insists Australia is not overly reliant on the United States.

title.children: Air force chief 'very comfortable' with response to Chinese warships

image.altText: Close up of a collection of jagged red rocks. In the background, two towers spitting flames.

props.synopsis: A prominent environmental lawyer warns that Peter Dutton's pledge to approve a major WA gas project within 30 days of taking office will expose the project to likely legal challenges.

title.children: Dutton's pledge to fast-track North West Shelf could expose it to legal challenge

image.altText: A child with day four measles rash.

props.synopsis: Health departments around the country are warning Australians to be alert for symptoms of measles as concerns grow about a rise in cases amid declining vaccination rates.

title.children: Measles was 'eliminated' 10 years ago. Why have cases started climbing?

image.altText: A man takes a photo of a pig's head in a black plastic bag

props.synopsis: Indonesian police launch a preliminary investigation into "acts of terror" against an investigative media organisation after carcasses were delivered to its Jakarta office.

title.children: 'Just cook it': Pig's head, dead rats sent to newsroom in Indonesia

image.altText: A portrait of Queen Mary of Denmark in a long dress with lace details on the sleeves and a crown.

props.synopsis: Genius move or "cheeky European vacay"? A cost-cutting regional council has narrowly voted to send its mayor and the city band on an expenses-paid trip to entice Queen Mary into a reciprocal visit.

title.children: Struggletown mayor off to Denmark to see the Queen — and lure her home

image.altText: Close up of four people in surgery scrubs.

props.synopsis: The trial was part of a small — but growing — group of animal-to-human organ transplants, in a practice known as "xenotransplantation".  But will pig livers eventually replace human organ transplants?

title.children: Chinese scientists transplant gene-modified pig liver into human body

image.altText: An older woman walks down a crowded aisle at a grocery store.

props.synopsis: Research from consumer advocacy group Choice has found the average basket of groceries is now costing Woolworths shoppers more than it was a year ago, while the price has fallen at both Coles and Aldi.

title.children: Choice report finds Woolworths groceries more expensive than a year ago

image.altText: Tom Green looks on during a GWS game

props.synopsis: Tom Green's teammates will tell you he's a hard player to get off the field. His excuse? He's completely deaf in one ear.

title.children: Completely deaf in one ear, this AFL star can be hard to get off the field

image.altText: Jamie Foxx picture Apple TV+

props.synopsis: Oscar-winning actor Jamie Foxx has produced a new two-part documentary, Number One on the Call Sheet.

title.children: Jamie Foxx on what Robin Williams taught him about being a leading man

props.synopsis: It's a budget with a surprise tax cut, so there must be an election coming up. Today, 7.30's political editor Laura Tingle tells us the new tax cut is the world's biggest 'neon sign', giving the Labor government a selling point for its fourth budget.

title.children: Laura Tingle on how Labor's tax cut 'snookered' Dutton
